intro: Pterichis multiflora var. multiflora, commonly known as the Japanese pterichis, is a flowering plant native to Japan. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes buckwheat and other related species. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or streamside habitats.
